poem_title: LONGING FOR HEAVEN, OR, THE Song of Angels Above.
author: Isaac Watts

lines.line_text: EARTH has detain'd me Prisoner long,
And I'me grown weary now;
My Heart, my Hand, my Ear, my Tongue,
There's nothing here for you.

stanzas.stanza_text:
EARTH has detain'd me Prisoner long,
And I'me grown weary now;
My Heart, my Hand, my Ear, my Tongue,
There's nothing here for you.

lines.line_text: Tir'd in my Thoughts I stretch me down,
And upward glance mine Eyes,
Upward (my Father) to thy Throne,
And to my Native Skies.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Tir'd in my Thoughts I stretch me down,
And upward glance mine Eyes,
Upward (my Father) to thy Throne,
And to my Native Skies.

lines.line_text: There the dear Man my Saviour sits,
The God, how bright he shines!
And scatters Infinite Delights
On all the happy Minds.

stanzas.stanza_text:
There the dear Man my Saviour sits,
The God, how bright he shines!
And scatters Infinite Delights
On all the happy Minds.

lines.line_text: Seraphs with elevated Strains
Circle the Throne around,
And Move and Charm the Starry Plains
With an Immortal Sound.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Seraphs with elevated Strains
Circle the Throne around,
And Move and Charm the Starry Plains
With an Immortal Sound.

lines.line_text: the Lord their Harps employs,
my Love they sing,
the Name of both our Joys
Sounds sweet from every String.

stanzas.stanza_text:
the Lord their Harps employs,
my Love they sing,
the Name of both our Joys
Sounds sweet from every String.

lines.line_text: Hark, how beyond the narrow Bounds
Of Time and Space they run,
And speak in most Majestick Sounds
The Godhead of the Son.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Hark, how beyond the narrow Bounds
Of Time and Space they run,
And speak in most Majestick Sounds
The Godhead of the Son.

lines.line_text: How on the Father's Breast he lay
The darling of his Soul,
Infinite Years before the Day,
Or Heavens began to roll.

stanzas.stanza_text:
How on the Father's Breast he lay
The darling of his Soul,
Infinite Years before the Day,
Or Heavens began to roll.

lines.line_text: And now they sink the lofty Tone,
And milder Notes they play,
And bring th' Eternal Godhead down
To dwell in humble Clay.

stanzas.stanza_text:
And now they sink the lofty Tone,
And milder Notes they play,
And bring th' Eternal Godhead down
To dwell in humble Clay.

lines.line_text: O the dear Beauties of that Man!
(The God resides within)
His Flesh all pure without a Stain,
His Soul without a Sin.

stanzas.stanza_text:
O the dear Beauties of that Man!
(The God resides within)
His Flesh all pure without a Stain,
His Soul without a Sin.

lines.line_text: Then, how he look't, and how he smild,
What wondrous things he said,
Sweet Cherubs, stay, dwell here a while,
And tell what  did.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Then, how he look't, and how he smild,
What wondrous things he said,
Sweet Cherubs, stay, dwell here a while,
And tell what  did.

lines.line_text: At his Command the Blind awake,
And feel the gladsome Rays;
He bids the Dumb attempt to speak,
They try their Tongues in Praise.

stanzas.stanza_text:
At his Command the Blind awake,
And feel the gladsome Rays;
He bids the Dumb attempt to speak,
They try their Tongues in Praise.

lines.line_text: He shed a thousand Blessings round
Where 'ere he turn'd his Eye;
He spake, and at the Sovereign Sound
The Hellish Legions fly.

stanzas.stanza_text:
He shed a thousand Blessings round
Where 'ere he turn'd his Eye;
He spake, and at the Sovereign Sound
The Hellish Legions fly.

lines.line_text: Thus while with unambitious Strife
Th' Ethereal Minstrels rove
Thro' all the Labours of his Life,
And Wonders of his Love.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Thus while with unambitious Strife
Th' Ethereal Minstrels rove
Thro' all the Labours of his Life,
And Wonders of his Love.

lines.line_text: In the full Quire a broken String
Groans with a strange Surprize;
The rest in silence mourn their King
That Bleeds and Loves and Dies.

stanzas.stanza_text:
In the full Quire a broken String
Groans with a strange Surprize;
The rest in silence mourn their King
That Bleeds and Loves and Dies.

lines.line_text: The little Saints with dropping Wings
Cease their harmonious Breath,
No blooming Trees, nor bubbling Springs,
While  sleeps in Death.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The little Saints with dropping Wings
Cease their harmonious Breath,
No blooming Trees, nor bubbling Springs,
While  sleeps in Death.

lines.line_text: Then all at once to living Strains
They summon every Chord,
Break up the Tomb, and burst his Chains,
And show their rising Lord.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Then all at once to living Strains
They summon every Chord,
Break up the Tomb, and burst his Chains,
And show their rising Lord.

lines.line_text: Around the flaming Army throngs
To guard him to the Skies,
With loud  on their Tongues,
And Triumph in their Eyes.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Around the flaming Army throngs
To guard him to the Skies,
With loud  on their Tongues,
And Triumph in their Eyes.

lines.line_text: In awful State the Conquering God
Ascends his shining Throne,
While tuneful Angels sound abroad
The Vict'ries he has won.

stanzas.stanza_text:
In awful State the Conquering God
Ascends his shining Throne,
While tuneful Angels sound abroad
The Vict'ries he has won.

lines.line_text: Now let me rise, and Joyn their Song,
And be an Angel too;
My Heart, my Hand, my Ear, my Tongue,
Here's Joyful Work for you.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Now let me rise, and Joyn their Song,
And be an Angel too;
My Heart, my Hand, my Ear, my Tongue,
Here's Joyful Work for you.

lines.line_text: I would begin the Musick here
And so my Soul should rise,
Oh for some Heavenly Notes to bear
My Spirit to the Skies!

stanzas.stanza_text:
I would begin the Musick here
And so my Soul should rise,
Oh for some Heavenly Notes to bear
My Spirit to the Skies!

lines.line_text: There, ye that love my Saviour, sit,
There I would fain have place,
Amongst your Thrones, or at your Feet,
So I might see his Face.

stanzas.stanza_text:
There, ye that love my Saviour, sit,
There I would fain have place,
Amongst your Thrones, or at your Feet,
So I might see his Face.

lines.line_text: I am confin'd to Earth no more,
But mount in haste above
To bless the God that I adore,
And sing the Man I Love.

stanzas.stanza_text:
I am confin'd to Earth no more,
But mount in haste above
To bless the God that I adore,
And sing the Man I Love.
